content: "http://www.reuters.com/article/latestCrisis/idUSN14484263" quote: The CIA on Thursday rejected a request by former Vice President Dick Cheney that it make public documents that he said showed the effectiveness of using harsh interrogation methods on terrorism suspects. Cheney had asked the agency to declassify two memos that he believes back up his contention that useful intelligence was gained through such methods. The Bush administration authorized the use of waterboarding, sleep and food deprivation and forced nudity as it sought information after the Sept. 11 attacks. The CIA said the two memos Cheney asked to be made public were relevant to pending litigation. "For that reason -- and that reason only -- CIA did not accept Mr. Cheney's request for a Mandatory Declassification Review," Paul Gimigliano, CIA spokesman, said. The interesting thing is that the memos that President Obama already released are part of the same "pending litigation". If those memos could be released, why not the ones that Cheney is requesting?
quote: The CIA on Thursday rejected a request by former Vice President Dick Cheney that it make public documents that he said showed the effectiveness of using harsh interrogation methods on terrorism suspects. Cheney had asked the agency to declassify two memos that he believes back up his contention that useful intelligence was gained through such methods. The Bush administration authorized the use of waterboarding, sleep and food deprivation and forced nudity as it sought information after the Sept. 11 attacks. The CIA said the two memos Cheney asked to be made public were relevant to pending litigation. "For that reason -- and that reason only -- CIA did not accept Mr. Cheney's request for a Mandatory Declassification Review," Paul Gimigliano, CIA spokesman, said.

title: CIA rebuffs Cheney over interrogation documents

The Bush administration authorized the use of waterboarding, sleep and food deprivation and forced nudity as it sought information after the Sept. 11 attacks. The CIA said the two memos Cheney asked to be made public were relevant to pending litigation. "For that reason -- and that reason only -- CIA did not accept Mr. Cheney's request for a Mandatory Declassification Review," Paul Gimigliano, CIA spokesman, said. The interesting thing is that the memos that President Obama already released are part of the same "pending litigation". If those memos could be released, why not the ones that Cheney is requesting? With the authority of the President the first memo's were release, retired VP Cheney suggested President Obama release all the memo's showing the information that was fundamental in fighting the war on terror. The CIA advised against any information being released. Then, today the Speaker of the House calls our CIA agents liars and deceivers. Easy to see how the Presidents speech to boost morale a few weeks ago has been nullified.

content: quote: Originally posted by mcgreer: This is all a waste of time. We know damned well what the law says. I believe these and a whole pile of other memo's will ultimately be released. The Republican strategy to tar the Democrats with torture, and/or torture works, is going to back fire BIG TIME. They have created tremendous presure on Obama to vindicate the Democrats.
